page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: Increased mechanisation & a decrease in stock-farming has reduced agricult- ural work in the parishes,eg.there are 4 farmers & 8 farmworkers in Bedingham now compared with 6 & 37 respectively in 1881.However the small businesses provide self-employment & eg.the vil- lage shop employs 1 other person. About 26% find work in the area,as against near 100% in 1881.Of those who commute,24% work for big firms such as Clay's the Bungay printers,Norwich Union Insurance Co.,Mackintosh of Norwich,Crane Fruehauf & R.G.Carter builder.As this is East Anglia 2 men in the oil industry is not surprising. Nearly 20% are professional people,in- cluding a GP, actuary, teachers, a librarian & nurse.Smallholders also gain income from other more lucrative sources.30% of the population is retired or widowed,only 5% unemployed.
